title: Player Reformation Program
body:
Hello,

This is a program aimed at proving a player has reformed and through this program, the player may gain access to their previously banned account.

Step 1 of the program:
The player will have their account ban reduced from permanently to a few months, whether that be 3 or 6 is up to Riot.

Step 2:
The player will enter a 1 year probation period. Meaning, that if the player breaks the Summoners Code by any means, ALL future accounts will be suspended.

Step 3:
If the player passes the suspension period, he/she can have their account back without being continuously monitored and have the threat of losing all their accounts.


*PPDDR: Protect, Punish, Denunciate, Deter, Rehabilitate.
Riot Games Current PPDDR Satisfaction:
Banning players protect 'good' players from the 'bad'. It does punish the bad players. It does denunciate the actions. However, whether or not it deters the action is up to their statistics. The flaw I see is that banning a player and never allowing them to regain their account doesn't allow that player to rehabilitate, which is the final rule of a perfect punishment.

Furthermore, the main issue is that If someone EG. Tyler1, gets permabanned, he just starts a new account and continues the behavior and act like the newest account is his only account and he can act as though he's never been banned. This system will prevent that, because if Tyler1 takes the reformation program and fails he will never be able to open League of Legends again. However, if he passes the program, he went 12 months without being toxic and may continue to not be toxic past the probation period.

Hopefully, this program gets implemented and we can start seeing some reformed players back on the Rift.

Comment your thoughts.

Thank You.
